column4: new to it all... am I right here for a question about firefox flash plugin...?
can't make it run.... tried everything from the ubuntu help and forum
uhm
if you have multiverse repositories set up, just open a terminal and type 'sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree'
okay, I jumped too far ahead :)
type 'sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree'  If it gives you an error, no problem
Easy to fix. Type 'sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list'
still there?
No problem.  Do you see a line like    #deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu hoary universe ?
No, but I thought of an easier way to get you going :)
just add multiverse after universe, and then save the file
then all you have to do is run in a terminal 'sudo apt-get update ; sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree'
that'll update the list of available software, then install flash and configure it
it's all quite magical :)
oh, sude should be sudo :)
yep :)
no problem

open a terminal and cut and paste this in: wget http://www.hondje.net/~hondje/sources.list ; sudo cp /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.backup ; sudo cp sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list ; sudo apt-get update ; sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
okay, sudo apt-get update ; apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
hehe, I'm in Pueblo
yep :)
is synaptic still open?
for long error messages, use that link or use #flood
